notes: Charger revival as four-door sedan on LX platform. Brought back Charger nameplate after 26-year hiatus. SRT8 variant with 6.1L Hemi. AWD available on some models. Based on Mercedes E-Class platform. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Charger article, January 2025 revision.

Modern Challenger revival inspired by 1970 original. Retro styling on LX platform. SRT8 with 6.1L Hemi. Manual transmission available. Pony car competing with Mustang and Camaro. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Challenger article, January 2025 revision.

Performance station wagon on LX platform. Shared platform with Charger and Chrysler 300. SRT8 variant with 425 hp. AWD available. Discontinued 2008 due to declining wagon market. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Magnum article, January 2025 revision.

Compact crossover/hatchback replacing Neon. PM platform (shared with Jeep Compass/Patriot). SRT4 variant planned but cancelled. Diesel engine available (2.0L VW turbodiesel). CVT transmission. Diesel service requires specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Caliber article, January 2025 revision.

Mid-size SUV based on Jeep Liberty KJ platform. Body-on-frame construction. Available with 4WD. Discontinued 2012 as Dodge refocused on cars. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Nitro article, January 2025 revision.

Mid-size sedan on JS platform (Mitsubishi GS platform). Replaced Intrepid/Stratus. Pentastar V6 introduced 2011. Production ended 2014. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Avenger article, January 2025 revision.

Mid-size crossover on JS platform. Three-row seating available. Replaced Caravan as family hauler option. Value-oriented pricing. Data sourced from Wikipedia Dodge Journey article, January 2025 revision.
